Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a large light-brown pottery vessel, perhaps a wine-jar, the exterior is covered with a cream-coloured burnished slip and faint traces of one horizontal register of black-painted hieratic text ending in the numeral 128 and beginning with an uncertain group.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393397) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393397)
